results.title: Where I'm @
results.brief_description: Ric is feeling on top of the world now he has found a place he can call home. Having lived on the streets he appreciates the simple comforts his new life provides.

results.title: Where have all the farms gone?
results.creator_credit: Michael Brun, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Tumbledown, weatherbeaten old barns and dwellings stand like gaunt skeletons of other times, reproachful of an economy that let them down. Unable to compete with food-chain marketing, the farmers have moved into town, and eventually the bulldozer applies the final indignity to buildings that once represented a full and wholesome way of life. Filmed in 1969 in the Upper Ottawa Valley of Ontario and Quebec, this film carries nostalgia in its mute question: What price progress?

results.title: Where have all the drivers gone? [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Eric L. Morris and Tarrif Insurance Companies
results.brief_description: A road safety film which stresses that most accidents are caused by careless and inattentive drivers, or by mixing drinking with driving. Graphic scenes of the resulting tragedies - maiming or death - should convince drivers to concentrate on driving or they may discover that the answer to “Where have all the drivers gone?” is “Gone to graveyards every one”! Narrated by Jim Berinson.

results.title: Where eagles nest. Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Frank Muscolino and Australian Wildlife Video & Documentaries
results.brief_description: Cameraman and director Frank Muscolino spent seven years in the Great Dividing Range and foothills recording the life cycle of a pair of eagles. There are four eagles in total that he follows, one pair lives in thick forest of the Great Dividing Range near Mount Disappointment. The second pair live in quite a different situation, nesting near farm land and having plenty of access to food. The director is able to win the trust of these majestic birds of prey, thus allowing him to capture close ups of mating, nest building and chicks growing up and being nurtured.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Muscolino and Australian Wildlife Video & Documentaries

results.title: Where eagles dare (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Brian G. Hutton, Elliott Kastner and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Richard Burton and Clint Eastwood star as Allied agents on a daring suicide mission in this tense wartime adventure. Held captive in an almost impregnable fortress in Bavaria, American General Carnaby is at the mercy of the German High Command. A group of agents attempt to liberate the General but as the mission progresses it becomes apparent that a double agent is attempting to foil this daring plot.

results.title: Where eagles dare
results.creator_credit: Brian G. Hutton, Elliott Kastner and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Richard Burton and Clint Eastwood star as Allied agents on a daring suicide mission in this tense wartime adventure. Held captive in an almost impregnable fortress in Bavaria, American General Carnaby is at the mercy of the German High Command. A group of agents attempt to liberate the General but as the mission progresses it becomes apparent that a double agent is attempting to foil this daring plot. Cast also includes Mary Ure, Micxhael Hordern, Patrick Wymark, Donald Houston. Based on the novel by Alistair MacLean.

results.title: Where does steel go
results.brief_description: Shows how steel is made into a variety of products at the Newcastle works of Ryland Bros., Stewarts and Lloyds, and other films. Among the products shows in process of manufacture are wire, steel fence posts, wire rope, steel pipes, corrugated iron and steel wheels for rolling stock.
results.description: Shows how steel is made into a variety of products at the Newcastle works of Ryland Bros., Stewarts and Lloyds, and other films. Among the products shows in process of manufacture are wire, steel fence posts, wire rope, steel pipes, corrugated iron and steel wheels for rolling stock.

results.title: Where does it come from?
results.brief_description: This video is presented in a dramatised format, where the young investigators in a children’s detective agency discover how some of the familiar items that we use or eat or wear in our daily lives are made: paper, pizza and denim jeans. After learning about the raw materials required, how they are processed, and how they are used, students will be better able to inquire about the origins of other everyday objects around their homes and schools. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.
